h1: How Many Calories in 2 Slices of Bacon?
assumptions: Standard pork bacon, pan-fried until crisp, drained; ~8g uncooked weight per slice.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut thickness, cooking method, and fat drainage. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two slices of cooked bacon provide ~86 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal for one cooked slice of standard pork bacon.
Yes, two slices have ~384 mg sodium—watch intake if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: How much fat is in 2 slices of bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 6.6 g total fat, including 2.2 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Yes—frying retains more fat than baking or microwaving with draining.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 2 slices of bacon?
faqs.a: Roughly 6 g protein, making it a decent low-carb option.
